lines.text: [receiving their uniforms]
Death shrouds
[flips one around]
They've got your names on the back.
So the guys at the morgue can identify the bodies.
That's it, I'm leaving the country. I'm moving to New Mexico.
You can't pitch to Johnny! I'm Johnny!
What's that cheerleader doing with a helmet on?
That's no cheerleader, that's my niece Becky. She's pissed.

[chanting before the game]
Giants! Giants!

[yelling and chanting]
Help us God!
[Danny is introducing the Little Giants to their parents]
Rudy Zoleteck, your friendly neighborhood gasman!
Gasman? I don't get it.
Think about it.
You always run the ball! Why can't I run the ball?
Because you're slow, and no one likes you
Peanut butter and jelly sandwich? Are you nuts?
It's still good!
You'll never get anywhere treating your helmet like a lunchbox son? What is that?
Cheetos.
Crunchy or puffed?
Puffed.
Wimp!
[Butz confiscates the food and walks off]
My mom made that!
[On the opening kick off, after the holder is kicked in the crotch by the kicker]
Oh! Somebody's holding a pound of Aunt Betty's nut butter, and that's a live ball!
[talking to his hands]
Why do you do this to me, fellas? I cut your nails, wash you, put gloves on you when you're cold.
[kids are running at try outs]
How'd I do, coach?
I don't know son. I don't have a sundial.
[saying grace]
God bless family, friends, flowers, Nickelodeon, fuzzy little kittens, Pez, Mr. Lerenzo, the school janitor 'cause he's so hairy.
He's an unfortunate man Priscilla.
What a hunk. Wait a minute? What am I saying? I'm the Icebox. Icebox doesn't like boys. Except for that one.
Here's a kiss for Murphey. And for Patterson and Briggs too.
[Farts loudly]
Look, you berzerko Barbie doll, when you mess with Spike, you mess with death.
You can talk the talk but can you walk the walk?
Try me!
I will!
Let's go!
Right now!
Somebody call 911!
Just remember, football is 80% mental and 40% physical.

[Recruiting Timmy]
Do you play football?
No.
Do you like football?
No.
Do you want to play football?
No.
Great, you can be on our team.
[laughs after Rudy farts]
Whoo! Whoo!

[to Murphy, Briggs, and Patterson]
This is a private establishment gentlemen.

[spying on the Giants]
This is incredible! They got the guards in the backfield! The center's on the right! And the quarterback isn't even there!
They're just standing around, Butz.
Oh, yeah.
[Murphy enters the club house immediately after Rudy farted]
[Groans in disgust]
Damn, Zolfart. What kind of road kill did your mom feed you last night?

[Smirking]
Free range skunk.
I don't know but I've been told.
Butz's butt is green with mold.
You say thank you I say please.
Kevin sits down when he pees.

[Keven and Danny are racing to claim the new player]
This whole town may love you, but I'm the only one who knows how truly sick you are!
I treated you like a prince!
You ignored me!
I took you to see the Cleveland Indians!
You left me at the stadium!
No mercy!
No ball.

[quietly doing a cheer]
give me a J. Give me a U. Give me a.
Is that lipstick?
No. It's a cherry tootsie pop.
Gee, I must be pretty bad if my own brother won't even pick me.
Danny, look at it my way.
I stink and you know it. You're perfect and I stink. That's it! The End!
No, that's not it. It's just that I'm so good that it makes you look really bad.
Are you trying to cheer me up?
Yeah.
It's not working.
See, so I stink at something too.
Ew, that's disgusting! It looks like they're trying to swallow each other's heads!
Ahh! It's a mom!
Don't be talkin' bout my momma!
Spike's in hell. Spike's in pee wee hell!
Put a fork in them they're done, baby.
Hey Danny! You see that water tower. One day our names will be up there in bold letters, The O'Shea Brothers! We're going to own this town, you and me buddy.
Hey Hanon, do you catch anything ever?
Caught a cold yesterday, Murph. Here! Have some!
[sneezes on Murphy]
Hey, I got an idea. How about we go put some mud tires on the go cart?
Nah. I don't want to.
Alright, forget the tires. How about we go camping in the woods! Make moose sounds?
Nah.
Alright, forget the moose sounds.
There goes my shot at the Pros. I gonna have to be a senator.
Hey Uncle Dan! Guess what? I got the whole headlock thing on tape. Here, wanna see?
That's right Spike! The Icebox is going to defrost you!
Your mine, Pom Pom!
My mom says the pads you gave me weren't enough.
Is Spike mistaken, but aren't you a girl?
Gee, good eye
Spike don't play with girls!
Every night before he goes to bed, I massage his hamstrings with evaporated milk

[When the Giants, losing at the half, want to be put on the injured list]
You know, there is something you guys should know. When I was 10 years old, I put myself on the injured list. I never got off.
Why?
Cause I didn't get picked a few times, so I started hiding under the bleachers.
That's where we belong, under the bleachers.
No you don't. You guys belong out there with those Cowboys. You know how I know that? Because I belong out there with my brother.
Give us a break, coach. You could never beat Kevin O'Shea at anything!
That's not true. I did beat him once.
When?
When we were kids. We used to race our bikes down Cherry Hill every day after school. We raced every day and he always beat me, but one time, one time I beat him.
You beat Kevin down Cherry Hill?
Yes, I did. He ate my dust.
Big deal. One time.
You know, one time at Randy Cooper's swim party, I did a backflip off the high dive, and my brother chickened out.
Roger chickened out? He's a Marine!
Ah, that's nothing! One time at the spring carnival, I beat both of my brothers in the Cow Dung Toss.
You beat Matt and Brett in the turd toss?
You know, one time I went fishing with my entire family, and I was the only one that didn't throw up.
So, what? It still doesn't make us good football players.

Well, wait a second, guys. Who said you had to be good to play football? You play football because you want to. You play football because it's fun. You play football so you could pretend you're Joe Montana throwing a touchdown pass, or Emmitt Smith going for a long run. And even if those Cowboys are better than you guys, even if they beat you 99 times out of 100, that still leaves.
One time.
One time.

[Smiles]
Yeah one time!
Peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Are you nuts?

[takes a bite]
It's still good.
You'll never get anywhere treating your helmet like a lunchbox, son.

[disguising his voice as a little old lady]
State police? Oh, thank God! My name is Thelma Mae Rogers, I'm 86 years old, I live in Urbania. There are two men down the bridge from the Shell station spying on some kids!
[passes the phone to Timmy, who starts to "cry"]
I just don't think it's right for men their age to be parading around in their underwear!
Please, hurry!
Oh no!
[hangs up the phone]
Nice job, Timmy.
[they high five]
Ready! Set! Go!
[Kevin takes off in a charging sprint toward a couch cushion, held by Karen]
Kevin! Aah!
[Karen lets go of the cushion and Kevin goes flying out the window, landing crotch first on a tree limb]
Oh! Doctor!
[in pain, he tilts and falls into their pool]
What's the matter, four eyes? Want your mama!
Don't be talkin' about my mama!

[as The Cowboys have possession of the ball; to Rudy]
Get ready dog breath. Because when I'm finished with you, you'll be farting out of your mouth and talking out of your butt!

[to Tad]
Is that physically possible?

[the Cowboys hike the ball and Spike gains enough yards for a first down; during the play, Murphy sends Rudy flying and landing on his face; After the play, the Little Giants check on Rudy, who's still down]
Are you all right?

[Talking out of his butt]
I think so.

[Impressed]
Huh! Guess it is possible.

[after Kevin plans a cheerleading squad for The Cowboys]
Yes!
You wanna learn how to kiss?
No. Why, do you?
No. Ew I just got that vomit taste in my mouth.
Come on, you gotta learn sometime. I mean if you wanna get a job and have kids and stuff.
You can have kids without kissing.
Yeah, but you can't get a job. You know, for scientific reasons and stuff.
Well become a teacher.
Kevin, this is pee wee football. It's supposed to be fun.
Not fun anymore. See, all the fun is gone now. See now, it's war!

[Spike has gotten the Cowboys penalized for a personal foul on the Little Giants]
Hammersmith, if that kid of yours pulls another stunt like that again, you are both out of here.
Hey, come on! I thought you wanted to win!
Not like that.
